thread.title: Every Single Finale Look at Prabal Gurung's Show Made a Powerful Political Statement
thread.title_full: Every Single Finale Look at Prabal Gurung's Show Made a Powerful Political Statement

title: Every Single Finale Look at Prabal Gurung's Show Made a Powerful Political Statement
text:
view gallery 34 Photos 
The fashion industry has responded to the Trump administration and the subsequent threats it has brought on our democracy across a spectrum: some designers have no qualms speaking out against Trump or against dressing the First Lady, some are more wary in their approach, perhaps not wanting to isolate any consumers. But at his fall 2017 show, Prabal Gurung made a loud statement in support of women's rights, black lives, and immigrants' rights. During the finale, as a version of The Beatles' "Imagine" played, models walked the runway wearing T-shirts proclaiming "This Is What a Feminist Looks Like," "I Am an Immigrant," "I am Coretta" and more. 
Take a look.
